com.tinkerpop.blueprints

Interface Graph

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IndexableGraph, KeyIndexableGraph, MetaGraph<T>, ThreadedTransactionalGraph, TransactionalGraph
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BatchGraph, DexGraph, EventGraph, EventIndexableGraph, EventTransactionalGraph, EventTransactionalIndexableGraph, IdGraph, LinkedDataSailGraph, MemoryStoreSailGraph, NativeStoreSailGraph, Neo4jBatchGraph, Neo4jGraph, Neo4jHaGraph, OrientBaseGraph, OrientBatchGraph, OrientGraph, OrientGraphNoTx, OrientTransactionalGraph, PartitionGraph, PartitionIndexableGraph, ReadOnlyGraph, ReadOnlyIndexableGraph, ReadOnlyKeyIndexableGraph, RexsterGraph, SailGraph, SparqlRepositorySailGraph, TinkerGraph, WrappedGraph, WrappedIndexableGraph

    public interface Graph
    A Graph is a container object for a collection of vertices and a collection edges.
    Author:
    Marko A. Rodriguez (http://markorodriguez.com)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Edge addEdge(Object id, Vertex outVertex, Vertex inVertex, String label)
      Add an edge to the graph.
      Vertex addVertex(Object id)
      Create a new vertex, add it to the graph, and return the newly created vertex.
      Edge getEdge(Object id)
      Return the edge referenced by the provided object identifier.
      Iterable<Edge> getEdges()
      Return an iterable to all the edges in the graph.
      Iterable<Edge> getEdges(String key, Object value)
      Return an iterable to all the edges in the graph that have a particular key/value property.

      Get the particular features of the graph implementation.

      Return the vertex referenced by the provided object identifier.

      Return an iterable to all the vertices in the graph.

      Return an iterable to all the vertices in the graph that have a particular key/value property.

      Generate a query object that can be used to fine tune which edges/vertices are retrieved from the graph.

      Remove the provided edge from the graph.
      void removeVertex(Vertex vertex)
      Remove the provided vertex from the graph.
      void shutdown()
      A shutdown function is required to properly close the graph.

    • Method Detail

      • getFeatures

        Features getFeatures()
        Get the particular features of the graph implementation. Not all graph implementations are identical nor perfectly implement the Blueprints API. The Features object returned contains meta-data about numerous potential divergences between implementations.
        Returns:
        the features of this particular Graph implementation

      • addVertex

        Vertex addVertex(Object id)
        Create a new vertex, add it to the graph, and return the newly created vertex. The provided object identifier is a recommendation for the identifier to use. It is not required that the implementation use this identifier.
        Parameters:
        id - the recommended object identifier
        Returns:
        the newly created vertex

      • getVertex

        Vertex getVertex(Object id)
        Return the vertex referenced by the provided object identifier. If no vertex is referenced by that identifier, then return null.
        Parameters:
        id - the identifier of the vertex to retrieved from the graph
        Returns:
        the vertex referenced by the provided identifier or null when no such vertex exists

      • removeVertex

        void removeVertex(Vertex vertex)
        Remove the provided vertex from the graph. Upon removing the vertex, all the edges by which the vertex is connected must be removed as well.
        Parameters:
        vertex - the vertex to remove from the graph

      • getVertices

        Iterable<Vertex> getVertices()
        Return an iterable to all the vertices in the graph. If this is not possible for the implementation, then an UnsupportedOperationException can be thrown.
        Returns:
        an iterable reference to all vertices in the graph

      • getVertices

        Iterable<Vertex> getVertices(String key,
                           Object value)
        Return an iterable to all the vertices in the graph that have a particular key/value property. If this is not possible for the implementation, then an UnsupportedOperationException can be thrown. The graph implementation should use indexing structures to make this efficient else a full vertex-filter scan is required.
        Parameters:
        key - the key of vertex
        value - the value of the vertex
        Returns:
        an iterable of vertices with provided key and value

      • addEdge

        Edge addEdge(Object id,
           Vertex outVertex,
           Vertex inVertex,
           String label)
        Add an edge to the graph. The added edges requires a recommended identifier, a tail vertex, an head vertex, and a label. Like adding a vertex, the provided object identifier may be ignored by the implementation.
        Parameters:
        id - the recommended object identifier
        outVertex - the vertex on the tail of the edge
        inVertex - the vertex on the head of the edge
        label - the label associated with the edge
        Returns:
        the newly created edge

      • getEdge

        Edge getEdge(Object id)
        Return the edge referenced by the provided object identifier. If no edge is referenced by that identifier, then return null.
        Parameters:
        id - the identifier of the edge to retrieved from the graph
        Returns:
        the edge referenced by the provided identifier or null when no such edge exists

      • removeEdge

        void removeEdge(Edge edge)
        Remove the provided edge from the graph.
        Parameters:
        edge - the edge to remove from the graph

      • getEdges

        Iterable<Edge> getEdges()
        Return an iterable to all the edges in the graph. If this is not possible for the implementation, then an UnsupportedOperationException can be thrown.
        Returns:
        an iterable reference to all edges in the graph

      • getEdges

        Iterable<Edge> getEdges(String key,
                      Object value)
        Return an iterable to all the edges in the graph that have a particular key/value property. If this is not possible for the implementation, then an UnsupportedOperationException can be thrown. The graph implementation should use indexing structures to make this efficient else a full edge-filter scan is required.
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the edge
        value - the value of the edge
        Returns:
        an iterable of edges with provided key and value

      • query

        GraphQuery query()
        Generate a query object that can be used to fine tune which edges/vertices are retrieved from the graph.
        Returns:
        a graph query object with methods for constraining which data is pulled from the underlying graph

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()
        A shutdown function is required to properly close the graph. This is important for implementations that utilize disk-based serializations.
